intro: Pultenaea whiteana, commonly known as the white pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant produces small, fluffy yellow flowers that are typically arranged in dense spikes, adding ornamental value to gardens. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and can thrive in coastal areas. Pultenaea whiteana is valued for its hardiness and ability to attract native pollinators.
